title: Special Encounters
intro: A Special Encounter is a type of Card that can be used while playing Eldritch Horror. They are tailored to specific Ancient Ones and will only be used when the Mystery that specifies them is in play. Some Ancient Ones have a Final Mystery that is a Special Encounter. Other Ancient Ones don't have them at all. Special Encounters are a form of complex encounter, similar to Other World Encounters or Expedition Encounters, in which there is a short narrative ending with a skill test or choice to make, followed by branching paths that are taken whether or not the investigator passes or fails this test, which each usually have their own skill tests along with a benefit or penalty for passing or failing. Passing all skill tests on the card will usually result in making progress toward the active Mystery. If the Special Encounter is part of a Final Mystery, failing any skill test on the card can carry heavy penalties, up to and including devouring your investigator.

_intro.text: A Special Encounter is a type of Card that can be used while playing Eldritch Horror. They are tailored to specific Ancient Ones and will only be used when the Mystery that specifies them is in play. Some Ancient Ones have a Final Mystery that is a Special Encounter. Other Ancient Ones don't have them at all. Special Encounters are a form of complex encounter, similar to Other World Encounters or Expedition Encounters, in which there is a short narrative ending with a skill test or choice to make, followed by branching paths that are taken whether or not the investigator passes or fails this test, which each usually have their own skill tests along with a benefit or penalty for passing or failing. Passing all skill tests on the card will usually result in making progress toward the active Mystery. If the Special Encounter is part of a Final Mystery, failing any skill test on the card can carry heavy penalties, up to and including devouring your investigator. They are tailored to specific Ancient Ones and will only be used when the Mystery that specifies them is in play. Some Ancient Ones have a Final Mystery that is a Special Encounter. Other Ancient Ones don't have them at all. Special Encounters are a form of complex encounter, similar to Other World Encounters or Expedition Encounters, in which there is a short narrative ending with a skill test or choice to make, followed by branching paths that are taken whether or not the investigator passes or fails this test, which each usually have their own skill tests along with a benefit or penalty for passing or failing. Passing all skill tests on the card will usually result in making progress toward the active Mystery. If the Special Encounter is part of a Final Mystery, failing any skill test on the card can carry heavy penalties, up to and including devouring your investigator.

A Dark God.text: A Dark God are Special Encounters related to Rise of the Elder Things. You are devoured. Lose 3 Sanity and gain a Dark Pact Condition. You are devoured. You are devoured. You are devoured. Gain 1 Bane Condition, 1 Illness Condition, and 1 Madness Condition. You are devoured. Discard all of your Clues, Ally Assets, Focus, and Improvement tokens. Then, lose 3 Sanity.

Black Wind.text: Black Wind are Special Encounters related to Nephren-Ka.

Cities on the Lake.text: Cities on the Lake are Special Encounters related to Hastur.

City Beneath the Sands.text: City Beneath the Sands are Special Encounters related to Nyarlathotep.

Corona Borealis.text: Corona Borealis are Special Encounters related to Hypnos. You are devoured. You are devoured. You are devoured. Gain a Dark Pact Condition and 2 Talent Conditions. Gain a Cursed Condition and an Amnesia Condition. Spawn 1 Gate unless you gain a Dark Pact Condition. If you spawn the Gate, move to that space. Each investigator on this space moves to a random space unless he spends 1 Clue.

Dark Pharaoh.text: Dark Pharaoh are Special Encounters related to Nephren-Ka. You are devoured. You are devoured. You are devoured. You are devoured. You are devoured.

Deep Caverns.text: Deep Caverns are Special Encounters related to Abhoth.

Dream Within a Dream.text: Dream Within a Dream are Special Encounters related to Hypnos.

Dreamwalker.text: Dreamwalker are Special Encounters related to Hypnos.

Exploring G'harne.text: Exploring G'harne are Special Encounters related to Shudde M'ell. An Ancient Cthonian Epic Monster ambushes you! An Ancient Cthonian Epic Monster ambushes you! Gain 1 Bane Condition. An Ancient Cthonian Epic Monster ambushes you! Lose 3 Sanity and become Delayed. Lose 3 Health. Advance Doom by 1. Gain 3 Injury Conditions.

Exploring Hyperborea.text: Exploring Hyperborea are Special Encounters related to Ithaqua.

Fortifying the Barrier.text: Fortifying the Barrier are Special Encounters related to Syzygy.

K'n-yan Unearthed.text: K'n-yan Unearthed are Special Encounters related to Yig.

Initial Text.text: At the entrance, a horrifying malformed creature staggers toward you. When it gets near, you see that it is the animated remains of a man's mutilated corpse. The creature attacks you (-1)!

Pass Effect.text: After overpowering this creature, you find a strange message carved into its chest (). If you pass, you see that this was once an intruder like you; place 1 Eldritch token on the active Mystery. If you fail, you do not understand the warning; gain a Cursed Condition.

Fail Effect.text: The creature throws you against the rocky wall. Lose 1 Health. You cannot enter K'n-yan, and its ancient mysteries remain unexplored, but you must not lose hope (-1). If you fail, advance Doom by 1.

Initial Text.text: Digging up the red clay-like earth of the area, you find a tube made of a strange type of metal. You open it and find a long scroll that describes K'n-Yan in detail (-1).

Pass Effect.text: You learn the story of a conquistador who became trapped in the underground city. This reminds you of other similar stories you've heard. You may spend 1 Clue to place 1 Eldritch token on the active Mystery. If you do not spend the Clue, you feel a sense of dread reading his story; gain a Paranoia Condition.

Fail Effect.text: Although you cannot decipher the scroll, you later recognize the engravings on the metal tube as a warning (). If you fail, you cannot prevent the magic from harming you; lose 1 Sanity and gain a Cursed Condition.

Initial Text.text: As you pass further into the caves, you see two large statues: one of Cuthulu and one of Yig, glaring at each other from either side of the passageway. You examine both statues (-1).

Pass Effect.text: You discover strange runes carved into the statues and try to translate runes (). If you pass, you learn the history of the serpent people who once lived here; place 1 Eldritch token on the active Mystery. If you fail, the statues leave you with a sense of dread; lose 1 Sanity and gain a Paranoia Condition.

Fail Effect.text: You barely notice the protective measures, both arcane and mechanical, on these statues and have only a moment to protect yourself. Gain a Cursed Condition unless you gain a Poisoned Condition.

Initial Text.text: You are surrounded by an army of ghost-like men, each one riding a strange translucent beast. They flood your mind with strange images, nearly overpowering your thoughts (-1).

Pass Effect.text: These beings crave knowledge of the outside world, and you provide them with as much information as you can (). If you pass, they share the history of K'n-Yan with you; place 1 Eldritch token on the active Mystery. If you fail, they try to keep you trapped in these caverns; Lose 2 Sanity and become Delayed.

Fail Effect.text: These immortal beings fill your mind with centuries of cruel, decadent memories. Gain a Hallucinations Condition. You attempt to banish the images from your mind (-1). If you fail, lose 2 Sanity.

Initial Text.text: As you reach the top of the mound and approach the entrance to the underground city, you are confronted by the animated corpse of a headless woman ()

Pass Effect.text: The creature seems to mean you no harm. Although communicating is difficult, you ask her for help in navigating K'n-Yan (-1). If you pass, she serves as your guide; place 1 Eldritch token on the active Mystery. If you fail, you wander long caverns; move to an adjacent space and become Delayed.

Fail Effect.text: In a panic, you attack the creature, much to your regret. Lose 1 Health and gain an Internal Injury Condition.

Initial Text.text: The serpent people have returned to the red-lit caves of Yoth and have resumed their endeavor to create new types of life. You sneak through the dark passages and attempt to covertly watch their experiments ().

Pass Effect.text: The creatures that the serpent people have created are horrific, and you resist the urge to look away (-1) If you pass, you learn the forgotten truths of Yoth; place 1 Eldritch token on the active Mystery. If you fail, you cover your eyes and wait for the nightmare to be over; lose 2 Sanity.

Fail Effect.text: The serpent people notice you and chase you through the scarlet tunnels of the underground city. A Serpent People Monster ambushes you!

Initial Text.text: The deepest cave is known as N'kai. The ghostly lights from the upper caves don't reach this depth, and it is difficult to navigate the path in the darkness ().

Pass Effect.text: You find several drawings on the cave wall that represent Tsathoggua. As you examine them, you are attacked by amorphous creatures made of viscous, black slime (-1). If you pass, you fend off the creatures and can learn the story of the toad god; place 1 Eldritch token on the active Mystery. If you fail, lose 2 Health.

Fail Effect.text: As you wander through the dark, you feel as if you've wandered across the threshold into some other world. Gain a Lost in Time and Space Condition.

Initial Text.text: You push open the massive doors of the temple and find almost every surface covered with gold. You gather as much of the precious metal as you can carry (-1).

Pass Effect.text: You've secured a fortune in gold. Improve . As you leave, a whispered hiss begins to emerge from the stolen items. You attempt to protect yourself from the venomous hex placed on the treasure (-1). If you fail, gain a Poisoned Condition.

Fail Effect.text: You struggle to carry the gold from the temple, dropping much along the way (-1). If you pass, you notice you've been deceived by an illusion, and you inspect the "treasure;" place 1 Eldritch token on the active Mystery.

The Key and the Gate.text: The Key and the Gate are Special Encounters related to Yog-Sothoth. You are devoured. You are devoured. You are devoured. You are devoured. You are devoured. Discard all of your Clues, Spells, and Improvement tokens.

Initial Text.text: A mass of glowing spheres, mouths, and tentacles burst forth from the portal. You feel a terrible intelligence searching your mind for signs of corruption. If you have a Dark Pact Condition, you are devoured. The Lurker then fills your thoughts with forbidden knowledge (-1).

Pass Effect.text: You exercise extreme mental discipline to regain control of your mind. By examining the images the Lurker has chosen to reveal, you believe that you can bind it between dimensions (). If you pass, you may discard 1 Spell to place 1 Eldritch token on the Ancient One sheet. If you fail or do not discard the Spell, lose 3 Sanity.

tables.Fail Effect: In one horrifying flash, your mind is flooded with knowledge of all places and all times as your molecules are torn apart. You are devoured.

Initial Text.text: Yog-Sothoth's avatar 'Umr-At-Tawil, stands before the Ultimate Gate. He is a tall figure, wrapped in gray fabric, and you can hear his thoughts thundering in your head. He warns you to proceed no further if you are afraid (-1).

Pass Effect.text: 'Umr-At-Tawil guides you through the gates to encounter Yog-Sothoth (). You may spend any number of Clues to add 1 success to your test result for each Clue spent. If your test result is 3 or greater, you are allowed to return home; place 1 Eldritch token on the Ancient One sheet. Otherwise, Yog-Sothoth threatens to trap you on the doomed planet Yaddith; lose 3 Sanity.

tables.Fail Effect: 'Umr-At-Tawil holds a large metallic sphere that radiates powerful pulses of energy. The rhythmic waves shake you to your core, tearing your body to pieces. You are devoured.

Initial Text.text: Carl Sanford stands high atop a mountain in a swirling dimension of his own creation. He claims that the Silver Twilight Lodge has harnessed the power of Yog-Sothoth to transform him into a god. However, you suspect much of what you see is an illusion (-1).

Pass Effect.text: Hoping to catch Sanford off guard, you lunge at him (). You may spend any number of Sanity to roll 1 additional die for each Sanity spent. If your test result is 3 or greater, you overpower him; place 1 Eldritch token on the Ancient One sheet. Otherwise, he manages to chant an incantation; gain a Cursed Condition.

tables.Fail Effect: You attempt to speak to Sanford, either to reason with him or to threaten him, but all that comes out of your mouth is a ritual chant, binding you to the Silver Twilight Lodge. You are devoured.

Initial Text.text: You can sense Yog-Sothoth in your thoughts, trying to consume your identity by filling your memories with ultimate knowledge. You struggle against the swirling energy that drags you forward, into the gate (-1).

Pass Effect.text: Rather than being consumed by knowledge, you repeat a chant that can allegedly purge a mind of all memories (). If you pass, you may gain an Amnesia Condition to place 1 Eldritch token on the Ancient One sheet. If you fail or do not gain the Condition, lose 3 Sanity.

tables.Fail Effect: You know the gate. You are the gate. You are the key and guardian of the gate. Past, present, future, all are one in you. You are devoured.

Initial Text.text: Despite the reports of the mad albino woman's death, she stands at this gate to wait for her child, the so-called Dunwich Horror, to call its father's name. As soon as she sees you, she casts a hex, and you attempt to produce a protective ward (-1).[2]

Pass Effect.text: Your protective ward surprises her. You tell her that she's the last of the Whateley clan, hoping to intimidate her (). Roll 1 less die for each Cultist Monster on the game board (minimum 1 die). If you pass, place 1 Eldritch token on the Ancient One sheet. If you fail, she recognizes your deceit; advance Doom by 1.

Fail Effect.text: You know of no way to shield yourself from her powerful sorcery. Gain a Cursed Condition, a Madness Condition, and an Injury Condition.

Initial Text.text: You see a circle of stones, each covered with magic runes. You sense that this is some sort of test of your knowledge (-1).

Pass Effect.text: You touch each rune in order, identifying yourself as a wizard. To your horror, you feel Yog-Sothoth taking over your mind, claiming you as its own (). Roll 1 less die for each Spell you have (minimum 1 die). If you pass, place 1 Eldritch token on the Ancient One sheet. If you fail, lose 3 Sanity.

Fail Effect.text: Yog-Sothoth does not recognize you as a sorcerer and ejects you from the gate; gain 2 Spells and a Dark Pact Condition.

Initial Text.text: The landscape around you changes constantly as Yog-Sothoth drags you through all worlds and all times. You search desperately for anything familiar to find your way home (-1).

Pass Effect.text: You sense your loved ones and mentally reach out to them for help (). Roll 1 less die for each investigator that has been defeated or devoured. If you pass, your body is snapped back to reality, place 1 Eldritch token on the Ancient One sheet. If you fail, you drift further through worlds beyond; gain a Lost in Time and Space Condition.

tables.Fail Effect: When your vision clears, you find yourself on a frozen plateau. No starts look down from the night sky. For a tragically brief time, you are the only living thing in the universe. You are devoured.

Initial Text.text: You are surprised to discover the indistinct silhouette of a man on the other side of the gate. Without knowing his identity, you try to convince him to help you navigate these strange other worlds (-1).

Pass Effect.text: He introduces himself as Randolph Carter and offers you his Silver Key. You try to harness its power (). You may gain a Dark Pact Condition to roll 3 additional dice. If your test result is 3 or greater, the key works; place 1 Eldritch token on the Ancient One sheet. Otherwise, you're hopelessly lost; gain a Lost in Time and Space Condition.

Fail Effect.text: He introduces himself as the wizard Zkauba, and he uses his arcane powers to steal your experiences. Discard all of your Clues, Spells, and Improvement tokens.

King in Yellow.text: King in Yellow are Special Encounters related to Hastur.

R'lyeh Risen.text: R'lyeh Risen are Special Encounters related to Cthulhu.

Initial Text.text: At the very peak of the island, you encounter a massive stone door featuring a horrific bas-relief of a dragon-like creature. Strange symbols are carved along the edge of the door. Some of the icons resemble drawings you've seen in books (-1).

Pass Effect.text: You spot a protective ward out of pace, hanging precariously. A member of your crew is on top of the door frame next to the ward. You warn him to carefully replace it (-1). If you pass, he does as you ask; place 1 Eldritch token on the active Mystery. If you fail, he fumbles it, resolve the fail effect.

Fail Effect.text: Somewhere on the other side of the enormous door, you hear a thunderous splashing sound and feels the ground shake as something approaches the island's surface. Advance Doom by 1.

Initial Text.text: As you approach the uncharted island, you hear the sound of a cannon and feel the deck shudder. You ship is badly damaged, and if you hope to survive, you must overpower the crew aboard the gunship Alert, the source of the cannon fire (-1)

Pass Effect.text: Once you have control of the ship, you find that it was filled with cultist devoted to Cthulhu. You search through their notes for information about the island (-1). If you pass, you find a folder with everything you need to know; place 1 Eldritch token on the active Mystery.

Fail Effect.text: The Alert's crew kill all of the sailors you were traveling with and knock you unconscious. When you wake up, you find yourself tied up in up in their makeshift brig. Gain a Detained Condition.

Initial Text.text: You swim up to the slimy rocks and walk into the corpse city of R'lyeh. Inside, cyclopean, green, stone blocks meet at non-Euclidean angles. The very sight of this alien construction threatens to shatter your mind (-1).

Pass Effect.text: Trying not to focus on the architecture, you instead take note of a series of hieroglyphics inscribed on the walls. You desperately try to interpret them for useful information ( -1). If you pass, place 1 Eldritch token on the active Mystery.

Fail Effect.text: Your life up until this moment has been a dream from which you are just awakening. You now understand that your true purpose is to offer yourself up as sacrifice to Cthulhu. Lose 3 Sanity.

Initial Text.text: Enormous silhouettes of flying creatures descend from the clouds. The star spawn have arrived! They attack with blood-chilling ferocity (-1).

Pass Effect.text: You survive their onslaught and hide yourself in a small cavern. You wait there for reprieve, listening to the terrible alien shrieks of the creatures (-1). If you pass, they eventually relent; place 1 Eldritch token on the active Mystery. If you fail, the noise places horrible images into your mind; gain a Hallucinations Condition.

Fail Effect.text: They crush you against the stones. You have no hope of standing up against their might; lose 3 Health.

Initial Text.text: Hundreds of deep ones surface from the water, crawling up the green stones. You hide yourself and watch their priest perform a strange ritual (-1).

Pass Effect.text: Although you cannot understand the words, the ritual reminds you of a similar ceremony performed by human cults (-1). If you pass, you recognize the moment when they will close their eyes and take the opportunity to escape; place 1 Eldritch token on the active Mystery. If you fail, you misinterpret the chant; resolve the fail effect.

Fail Effect.text: A loud croak informs you that one of the deep ones has spotted you. The monstrous fish creatures descend upon you from all sides. Lose 3 Health.

Initial Text.text: You recognize the alien landscape from a dream you've had. Lose 1 Sanity. You try to remember as many details as you can from the dream to navigate through the city (-1).

Pass Effect.text: You make your way to a hidden chamber lined with strange glyphs carved into the stone. Some of the symbols seem familiar (-1). If you pass, you learn the story of how the elder things trapped Cthulhu in the city; place 1 Eldritch token on the active Mystery. If you fail, the images fester in your subconscious; gain a Paranoia Condition.

Fail Effect.text: You quickly become lost and tumble down a long stone slope. Gain a Leg Injury Condition. As you climb to your feet you realize you're not alone. Spawn 1 Monster on your space.

Initial Text.text: A swarm of elder things bursts out of the water and flies over the large stone outcroppings. One of the creatures takes notice of you. It swoops out of the sky and tries to entangle you in its tendrils (-1).

Pass Effect.text: You keep the creature at bay, but several others have taken notice. You try to recall what you know of elder things (-1). If you pass, you know that they are enemies of Cthulhu, here to prevent his return, and you lie down and let them pass over you; place 1 Eldritch token on the active Mystery. If you fail, you run in a panic; resolve the fail effect.

Fail Effect.text: You are lifted into the air and thrown to the ground; gain a Back Injury Condition, a Leg Injury Condition, and an Internal Injury Condition.

Initial Text.text: Large tablets of black stone tower above you, each engraved with an R'lyehian, the blasphemous language of the star spawn (-1).

Pass Effect.text: You translate the strange symbols, used to invoke Dagon. You quickly shield your thoughts from his influence (-1). If you pass, you push the alien intelligence from your mind; place 1 Eldritch token on the active Mystery. If you fail, you retain control as long as you can before passing out; lose 1 Sanity and become Delayed.

Fail Effect.text: As you look at the tablets, a powerful presence invades your mind. Dagon floods your soul with corruption. Lose 2 Sanity and gain a Cursed Condition.

Sealing the Portal.text: Sealing the Portal are Special Encounters related to Syzygy. You are devoured. You are devoured. You are devoured. You are devoured. Spawn the Spawn of Azathoth Epic Monster on this space. Gain 1 Bane Condition, 1 Injury Condition, and 1 Madness Condition. Lose 3 Health and 3 Sanity. Advance the Omen by 1. Spawn 1 Monster on this space for each investigator on this space. Each investigator on this space moves to a random space unless he discards 1 Relic possession. Each investigator on this space loses 1 Sanity. Shuffle the Mystic Ruins Encounter deck.

Spawn of Abhoth.text: Spawn of Abhoth are Special Encounters related to Abhoth.

Sphinx's Labyrinth.text: Sphinx's Labyrinth are Special Encounters related to Nyarlathotep.

Unspeakable One.text: Unspeakable One are Special Encounters related to Hastur. You are devoured. You are devoured. You are devoured. You are devoured. You are devoured.

Void Between Worlds.text: Void Between Worlds are Special Encounters related to Yog-Sothoth.

Initial Text.text: From this bizarre place between worlds, you can catch a glimpse of all worlds and all times. You have an epiphany and search for a member of the Inner Circle of the Silver Twilight Lodge to observe (-1).

Pass Effect.text: You watch the wizard study, hoping to learn a ritual that will return you home (). If you pass, you open a mystic gateway to return you home; close this Gate and place 1 Eldritch token on the active Mystery. If you fail, you tamper with powers beyond your control; gain a Cursed Condition.

Fail Effect.text: The more you search, the less familiar the images seem. Soon you are surrounded by images of alien worlds you hardly recognize (-1). If you fail, gain a Lost in Time and Space Condition.

Initial Text.text: A small portal opens up before you and you see the laboratory of Crawford Tillinghast. You try to persuade him to make the portal large enough for you to pass through ().

Pass Effect.text: As you step through the portal, a creature also tries to pass through, and you must use the machine to close the portal (-1). If you pass, close this Gate and place 1 Eldritch token on the active Mystery. If you fail, the creature escapes and attacks you; a Monster ambushes you!

Fail Effect.text: Tillinghast laughs maniacally and send you hurtling through a multitude of worlds, shattering your perceptions of reality. Gain a Hallucinations Condition and a Lost in Time and Space Condition.

Initial Text.text: As you travel through this horrid, featureless void, you hear a sound echoing from the darkness ahead of you. A creature resembling an ape with the features of an insect shambles toward you. You feel compelled to run away in terror (-1).

Pass Effect.text: You try to hold onto the dimensional shambler as it fades into another world (). If you pass, you find yourself in your own world; close this Gate and place 1 Eldritch token on the active Mystery. If you fail, the creature throws you in the wrong dimension; gain a Lost in Time and Space Condition.

Fail Effect.text: The creature suddenly appears in front of you, having raveled through another world. Lose 1 Sanity and spawn 1 Gate.

Initial Text.text: You should not be here, and a hound of tindalos will hunt you down until it eliminates the alien element in this void! You hear it from your hiding place and try to not cry out in panic (-1).

Pass Effect.text: Once the creature has passed by, you follow the trail it left behind in hopes of finding a way out of this place (). If you pass, you find a route home; close this Gate and place 1 Eldritch token on the active Mystery. If you fail, the hound has led you into an ambush; lose 2 Health.

Fail Effect.text: Despite your best efforts, you shout and run as fast as you can. The hound catches you and drags you forward in time. Advance the Omen by 1.

Initial Text.text: Your fall through the void interrupted by a dense tangle of spider webs. Although you cannot see anything solid the webs are attached to, you think you could use the to climb to safety. You struggle to free yourself from the thick strands ().

Pass Effect.text: You climb up, but large spiders have sensed your presence. If your focus wavers, you'll never escape (-1). If you pass, you return to reality; close this Gate and place 1 Eldritch token on the active Mystery. If you fail, you're bitten by the enormous spiders swarming over you; gain a Poisoned Condition.

Fail Effect.text: You cannot escape. After what seems like an eternity, Atlach-Nacha herself carries you to realms you never could have imagined. Gain a Lost in Time and Space Condition.

Initial Text.text: You can't see, but you hear the sounds of a bird's wings flapping. Using your hearing alone, you try to follow the sound through the dark, twisting caverns (-1).

Pass Effect.text: The bird leads you to a campfire. An old wizard there tries to place a geas on you (); If you pass, he praises your strength of spirit and helps you; close this Gate and place 1 Eldritch token on the active Mystery. If you fail, you are sent back into the void; gain a Lost in Time and Space Condition.

Fail Effect.text: You cannot find the bird, but you do find a corpse dressed in ancient, hide armor. You imagine that he's been here thousands of ears. You know that even if you escape, there is no hope for humanity. Advance Doom by 1.

Initial Text.text: You are completely surrounded by the teeming globules that comprise Yog-Sothoth. The ancient being invades your thoughts to communicate with you. You struggle to decipher its horrific message. (-1).

Pass Effect.text: Yog-Sothoth offers you a terrible bargain. You may gain a Dark Pact Condition to close this Gate and place 1 Eldritch token on the active Mystery. If you do not gain the Condition, resolve the fail effect.

Fail Effect.text: The words and images that flood your mind do nothing more than confuse and disorient you. You're left wandering across alien landscapes, with no idea how to return home. Gain a Lost in Time and Space Condition.

Initial Text.text: You find yourself inside a black stone cave. The walls are covered with carvings of images and strange hieroglyphs. You think you can use the pictures to translate some of the hieroglyphs (-1).

Pass Effect.text: You recognize this as a means to use magical power to engineer an escape. You may discard 1 Spell to close this Gate and place 1 Eldritch token on the active Mystery. If you do not discard the Spell, gain a Lost in Time and Space Condition.

Fail Effect.text: You can only read a handful of passages, and saying the words aloud invokes an unintended consequence. Spawn 1 Gate.

Initial Text.text: At the entrance, a horrifying malformed creature staggers toward you. When it gets near, you see that it is the animated remains of a man's mutilated corpse. The creature attacks you (-1)!

Pass Effect.text: After overpowering this creature, you find a strange message carved into its chest (). If you pass, you see that this was once an intruder like you; place 1 Eldritch token on the active Mystery. If you fail, you do not understand the warning; gain a Cursed Condition.

Fail Effect.text: The creature throws you against the rocky wall. Lose 1 Health. You cannot enter K'n-yan, and its ancient mysteries remain unexplored, but you must not lose hope (-1). If you fail, advance Doom by 1.

Pass Effect.text: You learn the story of a conquistador who became trapped in the underground city. This reminds you of other similar stories you've heard. You may spend 1 Clue to place 1 Eldritch token on the active Mystery. If you do not spend the Clue, you feel a sense of dread reading his story; gain a Paranoia Condition.

Fail Effect.text: Although you cannot decipher the scroll, you later recognize the engravings on the metal tube as a warning (). If you fail, you cannot prevent the magic from harming you; lose 1 Sanity and gain a Cursed Condition.

Pass Effect.text: You discover strange runes carved into the statues and try to translate runes (). If you pass, you learn the history of the serpent people who once lived here; place 1 Eldritch token on the active Mystery. If you fail, the statues leave you with a sense of dread; lose 1 Sanity and gain a Paranoia Condition.

Fail Effect.text: You barely notice the protective measures, both arcane and mechanical, on these statues and have only a moment to protect yourself. Gain a Cursed Condition unless you gain a Poisoned Condition.

Pass Effect.text: These beings crave knowledge of the outside world, and you provide them with as much information as you can (). If you pass, they share the history of K'n-Yan with you; place 1 Eldritch token on the active Mystery. If you fail, they try to keep you trapped in these caverns; Lose 2 Sanity and become Delayed.

Fail Effect.text: These immortal beings fill your mind with centuries of cruel, decadent memories. Gain a Hallucinations Condition. You attempt to banish the images from your mind (-1). If you fail, lose 2 Sanity.

Initial Text.text: As you reach the top of the mound and approach the entrance to the underground city, you are confronted by the animated corpse of a headless woman ()

Pass Effect.text: The creature seems to mean you no harm. Although communicating is difficult, you ask her for help in navigating K'n-Yan (-1). If you pass, she serves as your guide; place 1 Eldritch token on the active Mystery. If you fail, you wander long caverns; move to an adjacent space and become Delayed.

Fail Effect.text: In a panic, you attack the creature, much to your regret. Lose 1 Health and gain an Internal Injury Condition.

Initial Text.text: The serpent people have returned to the red-lit caves of Yoth and have resumed their endeavor to create new types of life. You sneak through the dark passages and attempt to covertly watch their experiments ().

Pass Effect.text: The creatures that the serpent people have created are horrific, and you resist the urge to look away (-1) If you pass, you learn the forgotten truths of Yoth; place 1 Eldritch token on the active Mystery. If you fail, you cover your eyes and wait for the nightmare to be over; lose 2 Sanity.

Fail Effect.text: The serpent people notice you and chase you through the scarlet tunnels of the underground city. A Serpent People Monster ambushes you!

Initial Text.text: The deepest cave is known as N'kai. The ghostly lights from the upper caves don't reach this depth, and it is difficult to navigate the path in the darkness ().

Pass Effect.text: You find several drawings on the cave wall that represent Tsathoggua. As you examine them, you are attacked by amorphous creatures made of viscous, black slime (-1). If you pass, you fend off the creatures and can learn the story of the toad god; place 1 Eldritch token on the active Mystery. If you fail, lose 2 Health.

Fail Effect.text: As you wander through the dark, you feel as if you've wandered across the threshold into some other world. Gain a Lost in Time and Space Condition.

Initial Text.text: You push open the massive doors of the temple and find almost every surface covered with gold. You gather as much of the precious metal as you can carry (-1).

Pass Effect.text: You've secured a fortune in gold. Improve . As you leave, a whispered hiss begins to emerge from the stolen items. You attempt to protect yourself from the venomous hex placed on the treasure (-1). If you fail, gain a Poisoned Condition.

Fail Effect.text: You struggle to carry the gold from the temple, dropping much along the way (-1). If you pass, you notice you've been deceived by an illusion, and you inspect the "treasure;" place 1 Eldritch token on the active Mystery.

Initial Text.text: A mass of glowing spheres, mouths, and tentacles burst forth from the portal. You feel a terrible intelligence searching your mind for signs of corruption. If you have a Dark Pact Condition, you are devoured. The Lurker then fills your thoughts with forbidden knowledge (-1).

Pass Effect.text: You exercise extreme mental discipline to regain control of your mind. By examining the images the Lurker has chosen to reveal, you believe that you can bind it between dimensions (). If you pass, you may discard 1 Spell to place 1 Eldritch token on the Ancient One sheet. If you fail or do not discard the Spell, lose 3 Sanity.

all_encounters.Fail Effect: In one horrifying flash, your mind is flooded with knowledge of all places and all times as your molecules are torn apart. You are devoured.

Initial Text.text: Yog-Sothoth's avatar 'Umr-At-Tawil, stands before the Ultimate Gate. He is a tall figure, wrapped in gray fabric, and you can hear his thoughts thundering in your head. He warns you to proceed no further if you are afraid (-1).

Pass Effect.text: 'Umr-At-Tawil guides you through the gates to encounter Yog-Sothoth (). You may spend any number of Clues to add 1 success to your test result for each Clue spent. If your test result is 3 or greater, you are allowed to return home; place 1 Eldritch token on the Ancient One sheet. Otherwise, Yog-Sothoth threatens to trap you on the doomed planet Yaddith; lose 3 Sanity.

all_encounters.Fail Effect: 'Umr-At-Tawil holds a large metallic sphere that radiates powerful pulses of energy. The rhythmic waves shake you to your core, tearing your body to pieces. You are devoured.

Initial Text.text: Carl Sanford stands high atop a mountain in a swirling dimension of his own creation. He claims that the Silver Twilight Lodge has harnessed the power of Yog-Sothoth to transform him into a god. However, you suspect much of what you see is an illusion (-1).

Pass Effect.text: Hoping to catch Sanford off guard, you lunge at him (). You may spend any number of Sanity to roll 1 additional die for each Sanity spent. If your test result is 3 or greater, you overpower him; place 1 Eldritch token on the Ancient One sheet. Otherwise, he manages to chant an incantation; gain a Cursed Condition.

all_encounters.Fail Effect: You attempt to speak to Sanford, either to reason with him or to threaten him, but all that comes out of your mouth is a ritual chant, binding you to the Silver Twilight Lodge. You are devoured.

Initial Text.text: You can sense Yog-Sothoth in your thoughts, trying to consume your identity by filling your memories with ultimate knowledge. You struggle against the swirling energy that drags you forward, into the gate (-1).

Pass Effect.text: Rather than being consumed by knowledge, you repeat a chant that can allegedly purge a mind of all memories (). If you pass, you may gain an Amnesia Condition to place 1 Eldritch token on the Ancient One sheet. If you fail or do not gain the Condition, lose 3 Sanity.

all_encounters.Fail Effect: You know the gate. You are the gate. You are the key and guardian of the gate. Past, present, future, all are one in you. You are devoured.

Initial Text.text: Despite the reports of the mad albino woman's death, she stands at this gate to wait for her child, the so-called Dunwich Horror, to call its father's name. As soon as she sees you, she casts a hex, and you attempt to produce a protective ward (-1).[2]

Pass Effect.text: Your protective ward surprises her. You tell her that she's the last of the Whateley clan, hoping to intimidate her (). Roll 1 less die for each Cultist Monster on the game board (minimum 1 die). If you pass, place 1 Eldritch token on the Ancient One sheet. If you fail, she recognizes your deceit; advance Doom by 1.

Fail Effect.text: You know of no way to shield yourself from her powerful sorcery. Gain a Cursed Condition, a Madness Condition, and an Injury Condition.

Initial Text.text: You see a circle of stones, each covered with magic runes. You sense that this is some sort of test of your knowledge (-1).

Pass Effect.text: You touch each rune in order, identifying yourself as a wizard. To your horror, you feel Yog-Sothoth taking over your mind, claiming you as its own (). Roll 1 less die for each Spell you have (minimum 1 die). If you pass, place 1 Eldritch token on the Ancient One sheet. If you fail, lose 3 Sanity.

Fail Effect.text: Yog-Sothoth does not recognize you as a sorcerer and ejects you from the gate; gain 2 Spells and a Dark Pact Condition.

Initial Text.text: The landscape around you changes constantly as Yog-Sothoth drags you through all worlds and all times. You search desperately for anything familiar to find your way home (-1).

Pass Effect.text: You sense your loved ones and mentally reach out to them for help (). Roll 1 less die for each investigator that has been defeated or devoured. If you pass, your body is snapped back to reality, place 1 Eldritch token on the Ancient One sheet. If you fail, you drift further through worlds beyond; gain a Lost in Time and Space Condition.

all_encounters.Fail Effect: When your vision clears, you find yourself on a frozen plateau. No starts look down from the night sky. For a tragically brief time, you are the only living thing in the universe. You are devoured.

Initial Text.text: You are surprised to discover the indistinct silhouette of a man on the other side of the gate. Without knowing his identity, you try to convince him to help you navigate these strange other worlds (-1).

Pass Effect.text: He introduces himself as Randolph Carter and offers you his Silver Key. You try to harness its power (). You may gain a Dark Pact Condition to roll 3 additional dice. If your test result is 3 or greater, the key works; place 1 Eldritch token on the Ancient One sheet. Otherwise, you're hopelessly lost; gain a Lost in Time and Space Condition.

Fail Effect.text: He introduces himself as the wizard Zkauba, and he uses his arcane powers to steal your experiences. Discard all of your Clues, Spells, and Improvement tokens.

Initial Text.text: At the very peak of the island, you encounter a massive stone door featuring a horrific bas-relief of a dragon-like creature. Strange symbols are carved along the edge of the door. Some of the icons resemble drawings you've seen in books (-1).

Pass Effect.text: You spot a protective ward out of pace, hanging precariously. A member of your crew is on top of the door frame next to the ward. You warn him to carefully replace it (-1). If you pass, he does as you ask; place 1 Eldritch token on the active Mystery. If you fail, he fumbles it, resolve the fail effect.

Fail Effect.text: Somewhere on the other side of the enormous door, you hear a thunderous splashing sound and feels the ground shake as something approaches the island's surface. Advance Doom by 1.

Initial Text.text: As you approach the uncharted island, you hear the sound of a cannon and feel the deck shudder. You ship is badly damaged, and if you hope to survive, you must overpower the crew aboard the gunship Alert, the source of the cannon fire (-1)

Pass Effect.text: Once you have control of the ship, you find that it was filled with cultist devoted to Cthulhu. You search through their notes for information about the island (-1). If you pass, you find a folder with everything you need to know; place 1 Eldritch token on the active Mystery.

Fail Effect.text: The Alert's crew kill all of the sailors you were traveling with and knock you unconscious. When you wake up, you find yourself tied up in up in their makeshift brig. Gain a Detained Condition.

Initial Text.text: You swim up to the slimy rocks and walk into the corpse city of R'lyeh. Inside, cyclopean, green, stone blocks meet at non-Euclidean angles. The very sight of this alien construction threatens to shatter your mind (-1).

Pass Effect.text: Trying not to focus on the architecture, you instead take note of a series of hieroglyphics inscribed on the walls. You desperately try to interpret them for useful information ( -1). If you pass, place 1 Eldritch token on the active Mystery.

Fail Effect.text: Your life up until this moment has been a dream from which you are just awakening. You now understand that your true purpose is to offer yourself up as sacrifice to Cthulhu. Lose 3 Sanity.

Initial Text.text: Enormous silhouettes of flying creatures descend from the clouds. The star spawn have arrived! They attack with blood-chilling ferocity (-1).

Pass Effect.text: You survive their onslaught and hide yourself in a small cavern. You wait there for reprieve, listening to the terrible alien shrieks of the creatures (-1). If you pass, they eventually relent; place 1 Eldritch token on the active Mystery. If you fail, the noise places horrible images into your mind; gain a Hallucinations Condition.

Fail Effect.text: They crush you against the stones. You have no hope of standing up against their might; lose 3 Health.

Initial Text.text: Hundreds of deep ones surface from the water, crawling up the green stones. You hide yourself and watch their priest perform a strange ritual (-1).

Pass Effect.text: Although you cannot understand the words, the ritual reminds you of a similar ceremony performed by human cults (-1). If you pass, you recognize the moment when they will close their eyes and take the opportunity to escape; place 1 Eldritch token on the active Mystery. If you fail, you misinterpret the chant; resolve the fail effect.

Fail Effect.text: A loud croak informs you that one of the deep ones has spotted you. The monstrous fish creatures descend upon you from all sides. Lose 3 Health.

Initial Text.text: You recognize the alien landscape from a dream you've had. Lose 1 Sanity. You try to remember as many details as you can from the dream to navigate through the city (-1).

Pass Effect.text: You make your way to a hidden chamber lined with strange glyphs carved into the stone. Some of the symbols seem familiar (-1). If you pass, you learn the story of how the elder things trapped Cthulhu in the city; place 1 Eldritch token on the active Mystery. If you fail, the images fester in your subconscious; gain a Paranoia Condition.

Fail Effect.text: You quickly become lost and tumble down a long stone slope. Gain a Leg Injury Condition. As you climb to your feet you realize you're not alone. Spawn 1 Monster on your space.

Initial Text.text: A swarm of elder things bursts out of the water and flies over the large stone outcroppings. One of the creatures takes notice of you. It swoops out of the sky and tries to entangle you in its tendrils (-1).

Pass Effect.text: You keep the creature at bay, but several others have taken notice. You try to recall what you know of elder things (-1). If you pass, you know that they are enemies of Cthulhu, here to prevent his return, and you lie down and let them pass over you; place 1 Eldritch token on the active Mystery. If you fail, you run in a panic; resolve the fail effect.

Fail Effect.text: You are lifted into the air and thrown to the ground; gain a Back Injury Condition, a Leg Injury Condition, and an Internal Injury Condition.

Initial Text.text: Large tablets of black stone tower above you, each engraved with an R'lyehian, the blasphemous language of the star spawn (-1).

Pass Effect.text: You translate the strange symbols, used to invoke Dagon. You quickly shield your thoughts from his influence (-1). If you pass, you push the alien intelligence from your mind; place 1 Eldritch token on the active Mystery. If you fail, you retain control as long as you can before passing out; lose 1 Sanity and become Delayed.

Fail Effect.text: As you look at the tablets, a powerful presence invades your mind. Dagon floods your soul with corruption. Lose 2 Sanity and gain a Cursed Condition.

Initial Text.text: From this bizarre place between worlds, you can catch a glimpse of all worlds and all times. You have an epiphany and search for a member of the Inner Circle of the Silver Twilight Lodge to observe (-1).

Pass Effect.text: You watch the wizard study, hoping to learn a ritual that will return you home (). If you pass, you open a mystic gateway to return you home; close this Gate and place 1 Eldritch token on the active Mystery. If you fail, you tamper with powers beyond your control; gain a Cursed Condition.

Fail Effect.text: The more you search, the less familiar the images seem. Soon you are surrounded by images of alien worlds you hardly recognize (-1). If you fail, gain a Lost in Time and Space Condition.

Initial Text.text: A small portal opens up before you and you see the laboratory of Crawford Tillinghast. You try to persuade him to make the portal large enough for you to pass through ().

Pass Effect.text: As you step through the portal, a creature also tries to pass through, and you must use the machine to close the portal (-1). If you pass, close this Gate and place 1 Eldritch token on the active Mystery. If you fail, the creature escapes and attacks you; a Monster ambushes you!

Fail Effect.text: Tillinghast laughs maniacally and send you hurtling through a multitude of worlds, shattering your perceptions of reality. Gain a Hallucinations Condition and a Lost in Time and Space Condition.

Initial Text.text: As you travel through this horrid, featureless void, you hear a sound echoing from the darkness ahead of you. A creature resembling an ape with the features of an insect shambles toward you. You feel compelled to run away in terror (-1).

Pass Effect.text: You try to hold onto the dimensional shambler as it fades into another world (). If you pass, you find yourself in your own world; close this Gate and place 1 Eldritch token on the active Mystery. If you fail, the creature throws you in the wrong dimension; gain a Lost in Time and Space Condition.

Fail Effect.text: The creature suddenly appears in front of you, having raveled through another world. Lose 1 Sanity and spawn 1 Gate.

Initial Text.text: You should not be here, and a hound of tindalos will hunt you down until it eliminates the alien element in this void! You hear it from your hiding place and try to not cry out in panic (-1).

Pass Effect.text: Once the creature has passed by, you follow the trail it left behind in hopes of finding a way out of this place (). If you pass, you find a route home; close this Gate and place 1 Eldritch token on the active Mystery. If you fail, the hound has led you into an ambush; lose 2 Health.

Fail Effect.text: Despite your best efforts, you shout and run as fast as you can. The hound catches you and drags you forward in time. Advance the Omen by 1.

Initial Text.text: Your fall through the void interrupted by a dense tangle of spider webs. Although you cannot see anything solid the webs are attached to, you think you could use the to climb to safety. You struggle to free yourself from the thick strands ().

Pass Effect.text: You climb up, but large spiders have sensed your presence. If your focus wavers, you'll never escape (-1). If you pass, you return to reality; close this Gate and place 1 Eldritch token on the active Mystery. If you fail, you're bitten by the enormous spiders swarming over you; gain a Poisoned Condition.

Fail Effect.text: You cannot escape. After what seems like an eternity, Atlach-Nacha herself carries you to realms you never could have imagined. Gain a Lost in Time and Space Condition.

Initial Text.text: You can't see, but you hear the sounds of a bird's wings flapping. Using your hearing alone, you try to follow the sound through the dark, twisting caverns (-1).

Pass Effect.text: The bird leads you to a campfire. An old wizard there tries to place a geas on you (); If you pass, he praises your strength of spirit and helps you; close this Gate and place 1 Eldritch token on the active Mystery. If you fail, you are sent back into the void; gain a Lost in Time and Space Condition.

Fail Effect.text: You cannot find the bird, but you do find a corpse dressed in ancient, hide armor. You imagine that he's been here thousands of ears. You know that even if you escape, there is no hope for humanity. Advance Doom by 1.

Initial Text.text: You are completely surrounded by the teeming globules that comprise Yog-Sothoth. The ancient being invades your thoughts to communicate with you. You struggle to decipher its horrific message. (-1).

Pass Effect.text: Yog-Sothoth offers you a terrible bargain. You may gain a Dark Pact Condition to close this Gate and place 1 Eldritch token on the active Mystery. If you do not gain the Condition, resolve the fail effect.

Fail Effect.text: The words and images that flood your mind do nothing more than confuse and disorient you. You're left wandering across alien landscapes, with no idea how to return home. Gain a Lost in Time and Space Condition.

Initial Text.text: You find yourself inside a black stone cave. The walls are covered with carvings of images and strange hieroglyphs. You think you can use the pictures to translate some of the hieroglyphs (-1).

Pass Effect.text: You recognize this as a means to use magical power to engineer an escape. You may discard 1 Spell to close this Gate and place 1 Eldritch token on the active Mystery. If you do not discard the Spell, gain a Lost in Time and Space Condition.

Fail Effect.text: You can only read a handful of passages, and saying the words aloud invokes an unintended consequence. Spawn 1 Gate.
